main event: A large, round, bright light was sighted in Washington, D.C. on August 10, 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 10 to 15 minutes and remained stationary for the entire period,The light appeared different from stars and planets,At one point the light dimmed but regained its brightness,Several persons at the scene observed the object,The object's stationary position and absence of sound ruled out conventional aircraft.
witness description: civilian spectators, including a dentist and individuals at Fort Meade, VA
